|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = SanDisk;SDIN8DE4-16G; |flash1size = 16 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash2type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla2_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla2chip = Winbond;W25Q128FVFG; |flash2size = 16 |flash2maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash3maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 1 GiB |ram1chip = Micron;MT41K256M16TW-093:P; |ram1_num = 2 |ram2type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram2type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram2spd = <!-- 3400,3333,3300,3200,3100,3000,2800,2666,2600,2400,2133,2000,1866,1600,1066,1333,800 --> |ram2size = 256 |ram2chip = Micron;MT41K64M16TW-107:J; |ram2_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = Linux;3.14.28;
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = <!-- Number of USB Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = <!-- Number SD/MMC Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VAC |pwr_vac = 100-130 |pwr_ac_hz = 60 |pwr_amp_ac = 1.5 |pwr_conn = <!-- Connector Type --> |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = XFSETUP-XXXX, SETUP-1234 |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Quantenna;QT10GA;Quantenna, QT10GA-ES, AC11D2D0, E06487, 1707; |rad1chip2 = Quantenna;QT7810C;AB11F1D0, E06142-ES, 7810C-1701; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 8 |rad1rxchains = 8 |rad1sstreams = 8 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam1 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad1ac = <!-- 433, 867, 1300, 1733, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad1n = <!-- 150, 300, 450, 600, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad1a = <!-- 54, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad1freq = <!-- 2.4 or 5 or 6, Frequency band(s) of this radio -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Quantenna;QT10GA;Quantenna, QT10GA-ES, AC11D2D0, E06487, 1707; |rad2chip2 = Quantenna;QT6210B |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 800, 900, 1000, --> |rad2n = <!-- 150, 300, 450, 600, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad2g = <!-- 54, 108, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad2b = <!-- 11, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad2freq = <!-- 2.4 or 5 or 6, Frequency band(s) of this radio -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device is also known as the '''XB6-T''' for ''Comcast Xfinity'' *32x8 channel bonding - enables extreme cable Internet speeds *OFDM 2x2 - enables Gigabit Internet speeds :Compatible with ''Xfinity'' from {{Approved by service|Comcast}}
The SanDisk flash part number looks more like SDIN8D'''G'''4-16G but :I can't find any reference to that part. DFS support was added in a Class II Product Change request on 11/28/2017. :{{WiFiCert|WFA73469|10/16/2017}}
==Links of Interest== ===Press releases=== *[http://www.multichannel.com/news/cable-operators/comcast-taps-arris-technicolor-xb6-gateways-sources/409944 ''Comcast Taps Arris, Technicolor for XB6 Gateways'' on '''Multichannel News'''] :[[Technicolor]] made model to use [[Broadcom]] chipset :[[Arris]] version powered by [[Intel]] silicon
==See also== [[List of DOCSIS Cable Modems]] *[[Arris TG3442]] - [[Intel Puma]] 7 *[[Arris TG3452]] - [[Intel Puma]] 7 *[[Arris TG3462]] - [[Intel Puma]] 7 *[[Arris TG3482ER]] - [[Intel Puma]] 7 *[[Technicolor CGA4131]] - [[Broadcom]] BCM3390 *[[Technicolor CGM4140COM]] - [[Broadcom]] BCM3390 *[[Technicolor TC4400]] - [[Broadcom]] BCM3390
